entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Technical Analysis: BTC Rebounds Ahead of US Consumer Confidence Report
entry.summary:
After a three-day losing streak, bitcoin rebounded on Tuesday, ahead of the upcoming consumer confidence report in the United States. Price briefly fell below the $30,000 level earlier in the session, however bullish momentum has since returned. Ethereum rose above $1,900 for a short period.
Bitcoin
Bitcoin (BTC) rebounded from recent losses on Tuesday, ahead of the upcoming U.S. consumer confidence report.
The Conference Board expects its index to rise to a reading of 104.0 in June, up from 102.3 the month prior.
BTC/USD rose to an intraday high of $30,751.19 on Tuesday, following a low at $29,955.74 to start the week.
The move appears to have occurred as the 14-day relative strength index (RSI) bounced from a support point at 68.00.
As of writing, the index now sits at a reading of 70.17, which is once again in overbought territory.
A barrier at 73.00 is now the next visible ceiling, and unless bulls break out of this point, BTC will likely move back below $30,000.
Ethereum
Ethereum (ETH) briefly rose above the $1,900 level in today‚Äôs session, after falling towards a support level of $1,830 on Monday.
Following a low of $1,840.22 to start the week, ETH/USD jumped to a peak at $1,905.36 earlier in the day.
Momentum has since shifted, with the world‚Äôs second largest cryptocurrency once again falling below the $1,900 level.
At the time of writing, ETH is trading at $1,881.79, with the RSI marginally below a resistance level of 58.00.
Overall, momentum is bullish, following a recent crossover between the 10-day (red) moving average, and its 25-day (blue) counterpart.
Should this cross mature, there is a good chance that ETH will not only move above $1,900, but closer to $2,000.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Do you expect ethereum to reach $2,000 in July? Leave your thoughts in the comments below.

SEC Filings Impact: Emerging Ecosystem Tokens Tumble 25% In Market Cap
entry.summary:
In the world of crypto, the influence of regulatory decisions is profound. Recently, emerging ecosystem tokens witnessed a considerable downturn in market capitalization. This shift comes in the wake of the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) filings against prominent crypto exchange platforms, Binance and Coinbase.
These events have spurred concerns around the regulatory environment for cryptocurrencies and their classifications, notably affecting tokens such as Solana‚Äôs SOL and Polygon‚Äôs MATIC.
The SEC Ruling And Market Impact
Data from Messari, a leading provider of crypto market intelligence, highlights a significant drawdown in market capitalization for ecosystem tokens following the SEC‚Äôs filings. The filings identified tokens like SOL and MATIC as securities‚Ä¶

entry.title: Crypto Hubs 2023: Where to Live Freely and Work Smart
entry.summary: With shifting regulatory regimes worldwide, crypto is on the move to find the best locales to put down roots, get licensed, register or just be. Crypto Hubs 2023, our ranking of the top 15 global crypto hubs, is a good place to start.

entry.title: Zug: Where Ethereum Was Born and Crypto Goes to Grow Up
entry.summary: What is not to like about the tiny Swiss city where Vitalik Buterin and his cofounders launched Ethereum? The No. 1 spot on CoinDesk‚Äôs Crypto Hubs 2023 ranking has it all: regulatory clarity, crypto-friendly banks and a lively crypto job market and events calendar.

entry.title: Singapore: The Center of Asian Crypto Wealth Is Ready for a Reset
entry.summary: A fintech hub turned early crypto adopter, Singapore raised billions through ICOs. Cue parties on yachts and at luxury villas. But after the collapse of homegrown crypto darlings Terraform Labs and Three Arrows Capital, the No. 2 spot in CoinDesk‚Äôs Crypto Hubs 2023 is searching for the right regulatory balance to encourage crypto without getting burned again.

entry.title: London: The World‚Äôs Capital for Foreign Exchange Adds Cryptocurrencies to Its Ledger
entry.summary: Already a global hub for finance, the No. 3 spot in CoinDesk‚Äôs Crypto Hubs 2023 has a healthy grassroots crypto adoption rate and a prime minister eager to attract the digital asset industry.

entry.title: Seoul: Asia‚Äôs Retail Crypto Capital Moves on After Do Kwon
entry.summary: South Korea‚Äôs nearly 7 million registered users, many in the nation‚Äôs capital, show a huge interest in trading crypto. But CoinDesk‚Äôs 4th-ranked Crypto Hub for 2023 is still licking its wounds after the catastrophic collapse of Do Kwon‚Äôs Terra blockchain ‚Äì for a time, South Korea‚Äôs favorite crypto project.

entry.title: 3AC-Linked FLEX, OX Tokens Surge Despite Lack of New Holders

entry.title: Things Are Brewing In Prague
entry.summary: This is an opinion editorial by Joakim Book, a research fellow at the American Institute for Economic Research and contributor to HumanProgress.org and the Mises Institute. The first thing that met attendees when entering the venue at BTC Prague‚Äôs inaugural conference was the smell: a strong, new-rubber-type of scent that permeated most of the main stage area. The second was the light ‚Äî or the absence thereof: it was dark, with massive screens at regular intervals and neon lights shining elegantly across the ceiling. What likely remains etched into participants‚Äô memories is the dim, purple haze and those comfy, white VIP sofas in the front (paying up for VIP tickets has its perks!). A large BTC logo and slowly bobbing lamps hanging above the panelists on the main stage brought a spooky, s‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin Mining ‚Äòthe Highest User of Sustainable Energy‚Äô New Data Reveals
entry.summary:
Bitcoin mining is the highest user of sustainable energy and has similarly achieved the highest increase in sustainable energy mix between July 2019 and June 2023, new data has shown. The data also shows that bitcoin mining‚Äôs emission intensity has declined from more than 500 g/kWh seen in July 2021 to the June 2023 figure of 296 g/kWh.
Bitcoin Mining Has the Highest Increase in ‚ÄòSustainable Energy Mix‚Äô
According to the data comparing bitcoin mining to other industries‚Äô energy mix, the process to extract the top cryptocurrency ranks as ‚Äúthe highest user of sustainable energy (52.6%) across sub-sectors.‚Äù The data shows the banking sector as the next highest user of clean energy with 39.2%, while the gold industry is ranked fourth with 12.8%.
The data, which is based on the so-called B‚Ä¶

entry.title: Dubai: Launching a Crypto Regulatory Arm to Become a Global Financial Power
entry.summary: The center of the crypto universe has been shifting toward the UAE since March 2022, when Dubai announced the world‚Äôs first independent crypto regulator, the Virtual Asset Regulatory Authority. With its state intention to provide legal clarity for crypto, the No. 5 spot in CoinDesk‚Äôs Crypto Hubs 2023 has attracted jurisdiction shoppers such as Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao and crypto exchange WazirX.

entry.title: Abu Dhabi: A Wealthy Middle-East Capital Creating a Bridge From TradFi to Crypto
entry.summary: The heart of crypto in the capital of the United Arab Emirates is actually just offshore in the Abu Dhabi Global Markets, an economic free zone. With a mandate to encourage fintech, the No. 6 spot in CoinDesk‚Äôs Crypto Hubs 2023 keeps the lines of communications open between regulators and crypto institutions.

entry.title: Wyoming: Regulatory Clarity and Crypto-Friendly Banks Fuel Blockchain Revolution
entry.summary: America‚Äôs least populous state has passed three dozen laws regulating crypto. That has helped attract crypto, blockchain and Web3 employers and made the No. 7 spot in CoinDesk‚Äôs Crypto Hubs 2023 the most crypto-friendly state in an otherwise uncertain U.S. regulatory environment.

entry.title: Silicon Valley: The Mecca for Venture Capital May Be Cooling on Crypto
entry.summary: The storied birthplace of the U.S. tech industry is dripping with talent and money. But crypto founders who live in the No. 8 spot on CoinDesk‚Äôs Crypto Hubs 2023 list say that Web3 is losing ground to artificial intelligence in the race to capture the Valley's wallets and minds.

entry.title: Austin: Where Remote-Work Crypto Developers Actually Choose to Live
entry.summary: A critical mass of the world‚Äôs top Bitcoin developers and mining companies call the No. 9 spot in CoinDesk‚Äôs Crypto Hubs 2023 their home, lured by the city‚Äôs attractive weather, live music and food scene, as well as the lack of state income taxes.

entry.title: Berlin: The Center for Decentralized Finance ‚Äì and Techno Music
entry.summary: When the tech hub of Europe meets a society that prizes financial autonomy, the result is a crypto community that practices the very decentralization it preaches. Case in point: Blockchain Week Berlin, the flagship annual conference of the No. 10 spot in CoinDesk‚Äôs Crypto Hubs 2023, is a self-organized, crypto-agnostic community initiative.

entry.title: Los Angeles: Where Hollywood Magic and Creativity Meet Web3
entry.summary: The City of Angels is a global influencer in art, fashion and, especially, entertainment. Less known are its significant contributions in technology innovation. Together, the No. 11 spot on CoinDesk‚Äôs Crypto Hubs 2023 is a Web3 power. Plus it has the best movie stars.

entry.title: EU Reaches Agreement on Crypto Asset Regulations in Banking
entry.summary: The EU has reached a political agreement on regulations to safeguard the financial system from ‚Äúunbacked cryptocurrencies‚Äù and strengthen banks.

entry.title: Binance Australia Unexpectedly Cut Off From Local Banking System: Here‚Äôs More
entry.summary:
On May 18, Binance Australia made an announcement regarding the suspension of its dollar services. This action was taken in response to instructions received by Zepto, Binance‚Äôs payments provider, who was directed to cease their support for Binance by Cuscal, the partner banking and payments provider of Zepto.
During the Australian Blockchain Week on June 26, Binance regional manager Ben Rose addressed the audience, highlighting the significant impact of the move on approximately 1 million Australian customers.
This unforeseen development occurred without any prior notice, consultation, or opportunity for recourse. So, Binance customers expressed their concerns due to the initial lack of information, as acknowledged by Rose.
Related Reading: SEC Confiscates Terra Founder Do Kwon‚Äôs Cr‚Ä¶

Giger's original "Alien" statue on full display at this year's NFC Lisbon, Particle CEO Harold Eytan told Decrypt that owning an NFT-ified slice of the piece isn't just for fans of the iconic creature and movie series but also for fine art collectors. Interested in owning a piece? Be prepared to cough up half an ETH for one of the 500 tranches of the digitized sculpture.

entry.title: Community Co-Creation 'Is a Big Step for Fashion Brands' Entering the Metaverse: BNV Founder and CEO

entry.summary: At this year‚Äôs NFC Lisbon, multimedia artist and photographer YuLiang "YuYu" Liu broke down how themes from traditional painting and BDSM informed his latest NFT exhibition called ‚ÄúGAG.‚Äù He also shared exclusively with Decrypt a yet-to-be-launched drop for fans of his work.

entry.title: 'Competition Was Rather Low' in Mobile Wallet Space, Says Zerion Head of Growth
entry.summary: Zerion's move to launch a mobile-first crypto wallet not only helped NFT users swap jpegs on the go but was also a play to get away from crypto's desktop-centric user experience. And with such little competition, Zerion's head of growth Alexander Guy told Decrypt at NFC Lisbon it's managed to rake in 150,000 funded wallets. Next step? Taking on MetaMask and contending as a browser-extension wallet.

entry.title: ‚ÄòWe‚Äôve Never Seen Anything Like This in VR‚Äô, Says The Sandbox COO on Apple‚Äôs Vision Pro Headset
entry.summary: The Sandbox COO Sebastien Borget told Decrypt at this year‚Äôs NFC Lisbon that despite the high price point, Apple‚Äôs new VR headset is nonetheless ‚Äúgroundbreaking.‚Äù And though the tech giant never used the term ‚Äúmetaverse‚Äù in its reveal, Borget is sure that the technology will be key in growing participation in various digital worlds.
